title: TAGN Fantasy Critic League 2025 – Week Nine See Scores Go Up
description: We are now into week nine of the 2025 Fantasy Critic League… there is a long way to go, but we got some more games released this week, so scores went up. We left off at week eight with the scoreboard looking like this: Over the last week there were two league manager actions.  The […]
author: Wilhelm Arcturus
excerpt: We are now into week nine of the 2025 Fantasy Critic League… there is a long way to go, but we got some more games released this week, so scores went up. We left off at week eight with the sc…
text: We are now into week nine of the 2025 Fantasy Critic League… there is a long way to go, but we got some more games released this week, so scores went up. Fantasy Critic League – Like Fantasy Football, but for Video Games We left off at week eight with the scoreboard looking like this: The standings for Week 8 Over the last week there were two league manager actions.  The first I had announced last week, the removal of Wonder Woman as a pick due it being cancelled and the league warning me that I had to do something. League Manager Action Publisher Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod) has had the game Wonder Woman manually REMOVED by the League Manager. In addition, I made one setting change to help allow people to drop titles.  I was looking for the setting that was making the league alert me about cancelled titles, but this was all I found. League Year Settings Changed ‘Drop Only Drafted Games’ from ‘Yes’ to ‘No’. (at Monday, 03 March 2025) Maybe that will fix things.  It seemed like a good setting to change.  We shall see. As expected, we saw three titles release in week nine. Two Point Museum has released! Suikoden I&II HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars has released! Split Fiction has released! Two Point Museum already had a score last week and stayed firm with that. Two Point Museum [Picked by Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta)] Now has a score of 82.5 That is a good solid score. Split Fiction landed with an even better score. Split Fiction [Picked by Hare Brained Schemes (p0tsh0t)] Now has a score of 90.7 90 is very good, but every point AFTER 90 counts double, so a score of 95 or so can really set you up with a single title. And then there was Suikoden I&II HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars, which is too long of a name.  Perhaps it was the name that cause reviews to change over the course of a single day. Suikoden I&II HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars [Picked by Crash and Burn Games (Shawn)] Now has a score of 83.6 [4:02 am] Suikoden I&II HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars [Picked by Crash and Burn Games (Shawn)] Score has gone DOWN from 83.6 to 82.3 [10:02 am] Suikoden I&II HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars [Picked by Crash and Burn Games (Shawn)] Score has gone DOWN from 82.3 to 81.2 [12:02 pm] That wasn’t a huge drop, but it does demonstrate that scores can change. Also demonstrating that was Rift of the NecroDancer, which went up last week. Rift of the NecroDancer [Picked by Slightly Scuffed Studios (Kluwes)] Score has gone UP from 80.5 to 82.3 All of which left the scoreboard looking like this: The standings for Week 9 Potshot took over first place with the release of the Split Fiction, pushing everybody down a slot.  Potshot is now also projected to be in first place at the end of the season.  I remain projected at last place. We also had one bid this week. Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 + 4 Won by Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod) with a bid of $36 Coming up next week we have two releases coming, one on Tuesday and one on Friday. Coming Up for Week 10 One of those titles already has a score posted. WWE 2K25 [Picked by Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod)] Now has a score of 84.8 Scores only get added to totals when the game has officially launched, but that is a decent amount coming up. That will give us something else to chew on when it comes to rankings. Finally, there was one release update. Killing Floor 3 [Picked by Slightly Scuffed Studios (Kluwes)] Release date changed from ‘Tuesday, March 25, 2025’ to ‘2025’. Another release set for this month.  As always, all of these updates are narrated by the Fantasy Critic bot on the TAGN Discord server. Related: TAGN Fantasy Critic League TAGN Discord Server Fantasy Critic Site Fantasy Critic How to Play Fantasy Critic FAQ
html:
We are now into week nine of the 2025 Fantasy Critic League… there is a long way to go, but we got some more games released this week, so scores went up.

Fantasy Critic League – Like Fantasy Football, but for Video Games

We left off at week eight with the scoreboard looking like this:

The standings for Week 8

Over the last week there were two league manager actions.  The first I had announced last week, the removal of Wonder Woman as a pick due it being cancelled and the league warning me that I had to do something.

  • League Manager Action
    • Publisher Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod) has had the game Wonder Woman manually REMOVED by the League Manager.

In addition, I made one setting change to help allow people to drop titles.  I was looking for the setting that was making the league alert me about cancelled titles, but this was all I found.

  • League Year Settings Changed
    • ‘Drop Only Drafted Games’ from ‘Yes’ to ‘No’.
    • (at Monday, 03 March 2025)

Maybe that will fix things.  It seemed like a good setting to change.  We shall see.

As expected, we saw three titles release in week nine.

  • Two Point Museum has released!
  • Suikoden I&II HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars has released!
  • Split Fiction has released!

Two Point Museum already had a score last week and stayed firm with that.

  • Two Point Museum
    • [Picked by Rodent Entertainment (Arhanta)]
    • Now has a score of 82.5

That is a good solid score.

Split Fiction landed with an even better score.

  • Split Fiction
    • [Picked by Hare Brained Schemes (p0tsh0t)]
    • Now has a score of 90.7

90 is very good, but every point AFTER 90 counts double, so a score of 95 or so can really set you up with a single title.

And then there was Suikoden I&II HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars, which is too long of a name.  Perhaps it was the name that cause reviews to change over the course of a single day.

  • Suikoden I&II HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars
    • [Picked by Crash and Burn Games (Shawn)]
    • Now has a score of 83.6 [4:02 am]
  • Suikoden I&II HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars
    • [Picked by Crash and Burn Games (Shawn)]
    • Score has gone DOWN from 83.6 to 82.3 [10:02 am]
  • Suikoden I&II HD Remaster Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars
    • [Picked by Crash and Burn Games (Shawn)]
    • Score has gone DOWN from 82.3 to 81.2 [12:02 pm]

That wasn’t a huge drop, but it does demonstrate that scores can change.

Also demonstrating that was Rift of the NecroDancer, which went up last week.

  • Rift of the NecroDancer
    • [Picked by Slightly Scuffed Studios (Kluwes)]
    • Score has gone UP from 80.5 to 82.3

All of which left the scoreboard looking like this:

The standings for Week 9

Potshot took over first place with the release of the Split Fiction, pushing everybody down a slot.  Potshot is now also projected to be in first place at the end of the season.  I remain projected at last place.

We also had one bid this week.

  • Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 + 4
    • Won by Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod) with a bid of $36

Coming up next week we have two releases coming, one on Tuesday and one on Friday.

Coming Up for Week 10

One of those titles already has a score posted.

  • WWE 2K25
    • [Picked by Rusty Shackleford (Shilgrod)]
    • Now has a score of 84.8

Scores only get added to totals when the game has officially launched, but that is a decent amount coming up.

That will give us something else to chew on when it comes to rankings.

Finally, there was one release update.

  • Killing Floor 3
    • [Picked by Slightly Scuffed Studios (Kluwes)]
    • Release date changed from ‘Tuesday, March 25, 2025’ to ‘2025’.

Another release set for this month.  As always, all of these updates are narrated by the Fantasy Critic bot on the TAGN Discord server.

Related:

  • TAGN Fantasy Critic League
  • TAGN Discord Server
  • Fantasy Critic Site
  • Fantasy Critic How to Play
  • Fantasy Critic FAQ
